intro: Wikstroemia foetida var. vitiensis, commonly known as the VitiensisWikstroemia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Pacific. It belongs to the family Thymelaeaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to yellow. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, with lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in humid, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal or lowland forest environments.
